Joe Rogan Shares His First Electric Car Experience Crediting Elon Musk for 
Incredible Accomplishment With Tesla
text:
Latest NBA NFL NASCAR Golf Tennis ES Fancast Latest NBA NFL NASCAR Golf Tennis ES Fancast Home UFC Follow Us via Imago Image Credits: Imago The Joe Rogan Experience podcast could quite easily be one of the most popular podcasts in the world. Given the number of viewers it has and the fact that it doesn’t really budge from the No. 1 position on Spotify, given all its fresh topics, it is just another testament to the popularity of the podcast. During a podcast episode of Joe Rogan Experience with Aaron Rodgers that aired earlier this month, the two talked delved into the evolution of the motor industry. However, their conversion to how electric cars took over has piqued the interest of quite a lot of people. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad On episode 2099 of the JRE podcast, Joe Rogan and Aaron Rodgers talked about how electric motors took over despite being heavily criticized in the early years. Rogan mentioned the documentary “Who Killed the Electric Car” as they talked about how the concept was scrapped back in the ’90s and early 2000s. Follow Us The podcast host credited Elon Musk for bringing the technology back to life, as he said, “But if it wasn’t for Elon Musk, how long would it take before we figured out an electric car? You know, I mean, Elon was a part of Tesla early on, and Tesla’s been around I mean, I remember the first time I saw a Tesla. God, I feel like it was like the early 2000s.” He recalled the saying that the first person he saw driving a Tesla on the streets was Bill Maher in LA. What made the experience more memorable was the Maher’s license plate, which wrote “F*** OPEC.” It’s quite astonishing to see how much electric cars have evolved and made their mark on the motor industries. Rogan shows his appreciation for Musk whenever he gets a chance. The CEO of Tesla doesn’t skip a beat to do the same thing. Concussions” American politician, Robert F. Kennedy has been a guest on the JRE podcast in the past. And it would seem that the podcast host has made quite an impressive impression on RFK. During a speech, Kennedy didn’t miss a beat to compliment the 56-year-old, as he said, “If you’re young, and you have parents, you need to lock them up somewhere and get them to listen to a Joe Rogan podcast.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad A repost of the speech on X (Twitter), seems to have made quite a big splash on the social media platform. This even got Elon Musk backing Kennedy’s statement on Joe Rogan, as he commented on the post with a simple comment which wrote, “He’s right”.
